Minat Lanjutkan Studi ke Eropa Meningkat
04 Nov 2019, 09:28 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
 
BANDUNG, (PR).- Minat anak muda melanjutkan pendidikan tinggi ke Eropa terus meningkat. Salah satunya karena tawaran program beasiswa yang kian beragam.Duta Besar Uni Eropa untuk Indonesia dan Brunei Darussalam Vincent Piket mengatakan, indikasi peningkatan minat itu terlihat dari antusiasme masyarakat menghadiri pameran pendidikan tinggi Eropa. Tahun lalu pameran diselenggarakan di tiga kota yaitu Jakarta, Bandung, dan Surabaya. Jumlah pengunjungnya sampai 18.500 orang. "Tahun ini kami berharap jumlah kunjungan bisa meningkat lagi," kata Piket usai memberi kuliah tamu di Gedung Magister Manajemen Universitas Padjadjaran, Senin, 4 November 2019.Piket mengatakan, peningkatan minat itu juga didorong oleh program-program beasiswa yang ditawarkan untuk melanjutkan pendidikan tinggi di Eropa. Tahun lalu Uni Eropa memberi beasiswa melalui Program Erasmus kepada sekitar .1.800 pelajar Indonesia. "Tahun ini kami belum dapat angkanya karena aplikasinya masih berproses," tuturnya.Bidang ilmu yang dituju juga kian beragam. Ilmu ekonomi menjadi salah satu bidang yang mendominasi, termasuk diantaranta ekonomi bisnis dan pariwisata. "Yang kedua, topik-topik terkait kemanusiaan juga diminati. Mulai sari sejarah, sastra, hubungan internasional juga banyak. Selain juga sains, termask sains seperti matematika maupun sain terapan," tuturnya.Piket mengatakan, Uni Eropa mendukung program pemerintah Indonesia untuk meningkatkan sumber daya manusia. Menyiapkan sumber daya yang bermutu juga sejalan dengan tujuan EU.Ia mengatakan, EU ingin membangun kemitraan yang baik dengan Indonesia dalam berbagai bidang. Tak hanya lewat perdagangan dan investasi, tapi juga relasi antarorang (people to people) lewat pendidikan tinggi juga penting."Ketika orang Indonesia sekolah di sebuah universitas di Eropa, berkat visa schengen mereka bisa bepergian ke berbagai negara di Eropa. Mereka bisa belajar budaya dan bahasanya. Pengalaman hidup ini bisa dibawa kembali ke Indonesia. Sebaliknya, ketika berada di Eropa, mereka juga bisa jadi diplomat untuk negara Anda. Orang-orang di sana juga bisa belajar bagaimana kehidupan di sini," tuturnya.Bagi pelajar Indonesia yang ingin melankitkan studi di Eropa, Piket menyarankan agar rajin mencari informasi lewat website, utamanya situs resmi Uni Eropa. Di sana bisa didapat informasi terkait Program Erasmus terkait beasiswa dan pertukaran pelajar, juga ada program Horizon 2020 untuk penelitian dan pengembangan teknologi. "Itu dua program utama kami. Semua informasi ada di sana termasuk bagaimana cara nendaftar dan sebagainya," ujarnya.Tahun ini pameran pendidikan tinggi Eropa kembali diselenggarakan. Di Bandung akan digelar di Sabuga pada Selasa, 5 November 2019, mulai pukul 13.00-21.00. Sekitar 80 perguruan tinggi di Eropa ambil bagian di pameran ini. "Silakan datang, terbuka untuk umum dan hanya sehari," ujarnya.***

Interest in Continuing Study in Europe Increases
Nov 04 2019, 09:28 by Catur Ratna Wulandari

BANDUNG, (PR) .- The interest of young people continuing higher education to Europe continues to increase. One of them is because of the increasingly diverse offer of scholarship programs. The European Union Ambassador to Indonesia and Brunei Darussalam Vincent Piket said the indication of increased interest was evident from the enthusiasm of the people attending the European higher education exhibition. Last year the exhibition was held in three cities namely Jakarta, Bandung and Surabaya. The number of visitors to 18,500 people. "This year we hope the number of visits can increase again," Piket said after giving a guest lecture at the Masters Management Building at Padjadjaran University, Monday, November 4, 2019. The picket said, the increased interest was also driven by scholarship programs offered to continue higher education in Europe. Last year the European Union gave scholarships through the Erasmus Program to around 1,800 Indonesian students. "This year we haven't got the number yet because the application is still in process," he said. The field of science being addressed is also increasingly diverse. Economics is one of the dominant fields, including business and tourism economics. "Secondly, topics related to humanity are also of great interest. Starting from the essence of history, literature, international relations are also many. In addition to science, including science such as mathematics and applied science," he said. Picket said, the European Union supported the Indonesian government's program to increase sources human power. Preparing quality resources is also in line with EU objectives. He said, the EU wants to build good partnerships with Indonesia in various fields. Not only through trade and investment, but also people to people relations through tertiary education is also important. "When Indonesians study at a university in Europe, thanks to a Schengen visa they can travel to various countries in Europe. They can learn culture and "This life experience can be brought back to Indonesia. Conversely, when you are in Europe, they can also be diplomats for your country. People there can also learn how to live here," he said. For Indonesian students who want to launch studies in Europe, Piket advises diligently to search for information through the website, especially the official website of the European Union. There can be obtained information related to the Erasmus Program related to scholarships and student exchanges, there is also the Horizon 2020 program for research and technology development. "Those are our two main programs. All information is there including how to register and so on," he said. This year the European higher education exhibition was held again. In Bandung it will be held in Sabuga on Tuesday, November 5, 2019, starting at 13.00-21.00. Around 80 universities in Europe took part in this exhibition. "Please come, open to the public and only for a day," he said. ***
